title: Russian cargo ship launches in pursuit of International Space Station
summary: Russia’s Progress MS-19 supply ship launched from frigid Kazakhstan late Monday aboard a Soyuz rocket to begin a two-day pursuit of the International Space Station with more than 5,500 pounds of fuel, food, water, and experiments.

title: Maybe—just maybe—sending billionaires into space isn’t such a bad thing
Bipartisan legislation seeks to reform FCC satellite licensing rules
summary: The top Democrat and Republican on the House Energy and Commerce Committee announced a bipartisan effort Feb. 11 to update satellite licensing rules for the rapidly changing space industry.

title: SpaceX, Polaris reveal plans to launch private astronauts higher than ever before
summary: SpaceX and Inspiration4 creator Jared Isaacman have announced the Polaris Program, an initiative designed to carry the torch forward from Inspiration4 with...

title: One Year on Mars: Celebrate with the Perseverance Team
summary: Join the celebration as the Mars 2020 mission team shares their stories marking the one-year anniversary of Perseverance’s dramatic landing with events online and in-person.

title: SES forges Indian satellite capacity joint venture
summary: Luxembourg-based SES said Feb. 14 it has formed a joint venture with India’s largest telecoms operator to provide multi-orbit connectivity in the country.

title: Roscosmos launches 80th Progress vessel to the ISS
summary: Roscosmos launched the Progress MS-19 spacecraft on their 80th cargo resupply mission to the International Space Station (ISS). Progress MS-19, also known as Progress 80P, launch on a Soyuz 2.1a rocket from Site 31/6 at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan.

title: SpaceX and Isaacman to partner on series of crewed Dragon and Starship flights
summary: The billionaire who paid for and commanded the first private Crew Dragon mission last year announced Feb. 14 a program of additional missions that will culminate in the first crewed flight of SpaceX’s Starship vehicle.

title: Testing Rocks on Earth to Help NASA's Perseverance Work on Mars
summary: Using carefully selected terrestrial rocks, engineers try to figure out how to work with crumbly rocks like the one the rover encountered on its first sampling attempt.

title: Satellogic names former chair of the Pentagon’s joint chiefs Joe Dunford to board of directors
summary: Joseph Dunford, a retired U.S. Marine Corps general and senior managing director of Liberty Strategic Capital, has joined the board of directors of Satellogic.
